FacilityName: Holcim (US) Inc. / Geocycle LLC - Artesia Plant

_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Daily inspection; pumps, tank farm, agitators, piping
_prev_prog_3.Description:
Fuels Blending Process - This process consists of truck and railcar unloading, blending in a 6-tank tank farm, and loading tanker trucks and railcars in the same loading/unloading area.



The Holcim/Geocycle facility has implemented Program Level 3 Process Safety systems.  There are twelve elements under Prevention Program Level 3 that have been implemented:

?    Process safety information - written process safety information has been developed regarding the hazards of the process chemicals, the process technology, and the process equipment

?    Process hazard analysis (PHA) - PHAs are conducted every five years, or more often if required to manage changes to the covered process

?    Operating Procedures - All operations have standard procedures written and are periodically reviewed.

?    Training -  All employees receive training regarding process hazards, process safety and risk management systems, their job duties and responsibilities in an emergency, and other topics necessary to ensure safe operation of the facility.

?    Mechanical integrity - All equipment is part of a preventative maintenance program, including routine inspections and testing.

?    Management of change - The facility has a Management of Change Program to ensure potential hazards are addressed prior to implementing process changes.

?    Pre-startup review - Each new equipment startup undergoes a pre-startup review.

?    Compliance Audits - Compliance audits are conducted at least every three years to ensure the PSM and RMP programs remain effective and compliant.

?    Incident Investigation - Each incident is investigated and lessons learned are incorporated into the facility's operations and process safety systems.

?    Employee participation - All employees are involved in the PSM system.

?    Hot work permits - Hot work permits are employed to prevent fires and explosions.

?    Contractors - Contractors are selected after considering their safety records and credentials and receive training regarding the process and associated hazards.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Holcim (US) Inc./ Geocycle LLC facility in Artesia, Mississippi conducted a comprehensive applicability determination for the Risk Management Program (RMP) (40 CFR Part 68) regulations.  It was determined that the RMP regulations applied since the facility has received an RMP regulated Toxic Chemical since August 19, 1996 in quantities that exceeded the threshold level.  The facility receives, blends, and manages hazardous waste derived fuels (HWDF) which are used to replace fossil fuel consumption in the manufacture of Portland cement at other facilities.  The facility has decided to prepare and submit a RMP Plan to maintain future operational flexibility.



The Toxic Chemicals, vinyl acetate monomer, acrylonitrile, allyl alcohol, and propionitrile were selected to be addressed in the RMP Plan preparation based on an applicability determination.  The process involved at the facility includes handling, storage and blending in tanks and transfers to and from containers such as tank trucks and rail cars.  The facility is covered by the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) regulations and thus is subject to Prevention Program Level 3 as a result of the co-located Holcim cement plant's quarry operations being terminated and the site no longer being subject to the Mine Safety and Health Administration (MSHA) regulations.  This submission is predictive in nature since the subject chemicals are not always on-site at threshold levels.



Holcim/Geocycle management is committed to safe operations at the facility.  The company has an Environmental, Health and Safety Policy that clearly commits company resources to maintaining safe operations protective of human health and the environment.  The facility also has an active Community Advisory Committee to provide an avenue for discussing health, safety, and environmental issues with our neighbors.

The facility has had no incidents involving the release of the subject chemicals in the past 5 years.  No additional changes to

the site's safety systems are required or anticipated to allow continued handling of these chemicals.



The facility most recently conducted a Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) on August 21, 2018 on the HWDF operation.  The facility meets or exceeds the Prevention Program Level 3 requirements.



The facility is regulated under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act as a commercial hazardous waste treatment, storage and disposal facility (TSDF).  The existing Contingency Plan meets and exceeds the RMP regulatory requirements for the written Emergency Plan.  Local emergency planning agencies have been cognizant of the facility activities, reviewed the Contingency Plan and agreed in writing to provide assistance in the event of an emergency.



The Holcim/Geocycle management welcomes inquiries into our operations, and looks forward to answering any questions that the public may have.  Please contact the emergency contact identified in this plan if you have any questions.
